alert.note: Alert for Benton; Iowa; Jefferson; Johnson; Keokuk; Linn; Washington (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 31 at 4:57PM CDT until March 31 at 5:45PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: The National Weather Service in the Quad Cities has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Keokuk County in southeastern Iowa... Western Johnson County in east central Iowa... Southern Benton County in east central Iowa... Washington County in southeastern Iowa... Northwestern Jefferson County in southeastern Iowa... Southwestern Linn County in east central Iowa... Iowa County in east central Iowa... * Until 545 PM CDT. * At 457 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Holiday Lake to Pekin, moving northeast at 65 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Severe thunderstorms will be near... Belle Plaine, Richland and Koszta around 505 PM CDT. Blairstown, Keystone, Luzerne, Rubio, Talleyrand and Hannen Lake Park around 510 PM CDT. Van Horne and Keota around 515 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these severe thunderstorms include Newhall, West Chester, Washington County Fairgrounds, Washington, Atkins, Shellsburg, Richmond, Palo, Toddville, Pleasant Creek State Recreation Area, Hiawatha, Robins, Riverside and Lafayette. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for southeastern and east central Iowa. Prepare immediately for large hail and damaging winds. People outside should move immediately to shelter inside a strong building. Stay away from windows. These are dangerous storms, capable of producing large hail driven by severe winds! SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows! If you are caught outdoors, cover your head and neck. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for southeastern and east central Iowa.
